business.headline: Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

Infosys, TCS, TechM, HCLTech down: Why are IT stocks falling today?At the opening bell, major IT names fell sharply. Infosys dropped 1.91%, Tech Mahindra slipped 0.66%, HCLTech fell 0.29%, and TCS declined 0.36%.

entertainment.headline: At 60, SRK's Chaiyya Chaiyya moves with Farah wow fans all over again. Watch Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan and choreographer Farah Khan entertained attendees at a recent Mumbai event, marking the unveiling of the Shahrukhz tower, with a dance performance to the classic song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya'. The event drew attention both for the property launch and Khan's noteworthy energy at 60.

Wuthering Heights trailer: Margot Robbie, Jacob Elordi blaze in dark love tale The trailer for Emerald Fennell's adaptation of Emily Bronte's novel 'Wuthering Heights', starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, was released on Thursday. The preview highlights the characters' early connection and the challenges they face as they grow older.

Dining With The Kapoors: Kareena finds Taimur's twin in Saif's childhood pic Netflix has unveiled a teaser for 'Dining With The Kapoors', offering viewers an intimate look at the Kapoor family's traditions and playful moments ahead of the show's trailer release.

Rajkummar Rao, Patralekhaa welcome baby girl on 4th wedding anniversary Congratulations have been pouring in for the couple, Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, as they welcomed a baby girl on their fourth wedding anniversary. The two, who got married in 2021, announced their pregnancy in July.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agency South Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19: And then there were nine, so who'll be crowned winner? 'Bigg Boss 19', hosted by Salman Khan, is set to conclude soon with nine finalists battling for the trophy. Here are all the contestants, with their pros, cons and equation with the host.

BB 19 Day 83: Gaurav overthrown after ration cut; Malti faces sexuality rumours Day 83 of Bigg Boss 19 saw Gaurav Khanna rapidly dethroned after sacrificing the ration for captaincy, landing him in nominations. The episode escalated with a sexuality discussion about Malti Chahar, a major Tanya-Farrhana clash, and Pranit More's stand-up critique.

In Your Dreams review: Netflix serves up a warm, dreamy, feel-good storyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 In Your Dreams movie review: Netflix's animated film is a heartwarming story of a brother-sister duo out on a dreamy adventure to ensure their 'family stay together, happily'.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proud Shah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.

Tere Ishk Mein trailer: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon unleash love's madness, heartbreak The trailer of Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's much-awaited film 'Tere Ishk Mein' is finally out. Directed by Aanand L Rai, the film is slated to release on November 28.

Michelle Yeoh to receive Honourary Golden Bear at Berlinale Palast 2026 Actor Michelle Yeoh will receive the Honorary Golden Bear at the 2026 Berlinale for her outstanding film career. This recognition highlights her impact on global cinema and marks a historic milestone for Asian artists.

Saiyaara gets Popular Choice Award at Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025 Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its winning streak by bagging the Popular Choice Award at the Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025. With Rs 570 crore worldwide earnings and a historic Billboard Top 10 track, the romantic drama stands as one of Indian cinema's most celebrated love stories.

Kajol jokes she wishes to shrink Yug and Nysa, celebrates Children's Day Kajol shared adorable pictures with Yug and Nysa Devgn on Children's Day. She offered a lighthearted perspective on parenting, saying can we just shrink them? Check out the post here.

Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal's wedding card reportedly goes viral. See pic A wedding card is circulating on social media featuring the names of Palash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana. This has led to widespread rumours about their upcoming nuptials.

Millie Bobby Brown snaps at paps for asking her to smile at Stranger Things event Millie Bobby Brown confronted photographers who told her to smile at the Stranger Things Season 5 London premiere. The exchange went viral, sparking mixed reactions among fans and on social media.

Inspection Bungalow review: Flashes of fun in an uneven horror-comedyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 'Inspection Bunglow', the Zee 5 horror-comedy series, arrives with an intriguing setup and a cast willing to play along, but the writing and execution never fully rise to the potential of its premise.

Kareena Kapoor shares her bits and bobs of life in new post. See here Kareena Kapoor Khan delighted fans by sharing candid "bits and bobs" from her personal and work life, including family moments, set glimpses, and an adorable video with son Jeh. The actor is also gearing up for her upcoming Netflix documentary 'Dining with the Kapoors' and the shoot of Meghna Gulzar's crime-drama 'Daayra'.

European Union Film Festival curator Artur on Mira Nair, Payal Kapadia and India European Union Film Festival curator Artur Zaborski reflects on his love for Indian cinema, Mira Nair, 'The Lunchbox', 'All We Imagine As Light', in an exclusive interview with India Today. He also spoke about bridging the gap between India and the European Union.

general news.headline: 9 dead, over 25 injured in J&K police station as stored explosives detonateThe blast, triggered during the handling of explosives seized in the Faridabad terror module case, ripped through Srinagar's Nowgam Police Station on Friday night.

Election wasn't fair from the beginning: Rahul Gandhi after Congress' Bihar drubbingCalling the Bihar verdict a setback that warrants introspection, Gandhi said the Congress and the INDIA bloc would "deeply review" the results and strengthen their efforts going forward.

The curse of Dara Sikoh in Bihar?The Yadav family feud wasn't a private affair. It was a political earthquake. Tej Pratap's rebellion, Rohini Acharya's social media storm, and their widening rift with Tejashwi split loyalties and handed the NDA a golden opportunity to paint the RJD as a party consumed by infighting. An ageing patriarch, Lalu Prasad Yadav, is now left to witness the unravelling of the political dynasty he built.

IND vs SA 1st Test Day 2 Live: Gill retires hurt, Pant joins RahulIndia vs South Africa 1st Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: After Simon Harmer got the wicket of Washington Sundar, Shubman Gill has retired hurt due to a neck spasm. Rishabh Pant has joined KL Rahul in the middle.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proudShah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.

Bihar Singham stumbles: Ex-IPS officer poll debut falls flat after twin-seat defeatFormer IPS officer and Bihar's "Singham" Shivdeep Lande faced a setback in his political debut, losing both Araria and Jamalpur seats in the 2025 Assembly elections.

Who is Dr Nisar Hassan, 'ticking time bomb' under lens in Faridabad terror probeOnce dismissed as a "ticking time bomb" by the Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor for alleged separatist leanings, Dr Nisar ul Hassan is back under scrutiny as investigators probe his links to a "white-collar" Jaish module tied to the Red Fort blast case.

Sanju Samson joins CSK, Ravindra Jadeja back in Rajasthan after a decadeCSK's decision to overhaul its core has triggered one of the most significant trades in recent IPL history, with Sanju Samson moving to Chennai for Rs 18 crore and Ravindra Jadeja returning to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 14 crore.

Video: CCTV shows shockwaves from Red Fort blast shaking ground 40 feet belowExclusive CCTV from the underground Red Fort Metro station shows how fierce the blast was. The tremors shook the station nearly 40 feet below, jolting food counters and startling commuters. The violent vibration captured on camera underlines the sheer force of the explosion above.

J&K top cop rules out terror angle in Nowgam blast: Speculation unnecessaryNine people died and 32 were injured after explosive material recovered from a terror-linked case accidentally detonated at Nowgam Police Station, prompting a full structural assessment across Jammu and Kashmir.

Caught on cam: Speeding car rams scooter in UP's Jhansi; 2 injured, driver fleesA CCTV camera captured a speeding car ramming a scooter in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, leaving two men critically injured. The driver fled the scene.
The eerie parallels between 1993 and 2025The doctors' module aimed at replicating the serial blasts which ripped through India's economic capital.

Rajkummar Rao, Patralekhaa welcome baby girl on 4th wedding anniversaryCongratulations have been pouring in for the couple, Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, as they welcomed a baby girl on their fourth wedding anniversary. The two, who got married in 2021, announced their pregnancy in July.

Jaish proxy claims responsibility for J&K police station blast. What is PAFF?Srinagar blast: Security agencies are probing two possible angles behind the powerful explosion that rocked the Nowgam police station premises in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday. A Jaish proxy, PAFF, has claimed responsibility for the blast.

Bihar done, Bengal next, BJP will uproot jungle raj there: PM's big messageAfter the NDA was projected to win more than 200 of the 243 Assembly seats in Bihar, PM Modi exuded confidence that the BJP will repeat the feat in Bengal in 2026.

Viral: UP rape survivor pushes past cops, runs to senior officer to plead her caseA gang-rape survivor in UP defied police obstruction to meet the DIG, demanding swift arrest of the remaining accused, in a video that has gone viral.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agencySouth Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

How Nitish Kumar powered NDA's 200+ punch that knocked Opposition coldIn a state deeply entrenched in caste politics, Nitish Kumar, a Kurmi who makes up barely 3% of the population, rose above caste lines to deliver a counter-punch to his opponents - who have historically boasted of holding sway over Muslims and Yadavs, who together constitute 32%.

She was just 21 and led an armed attack on the British RajPritilata Waddedar led a courageous attack against British colonial racism in 1932. Her martyrdom became a powerful symbol of female defiance in India's freedom struggle.

BeanTok: Can two cups of beans a day fix the Indian gut?Social media is currently obsessing over beans for better gut health, sleep, and mood. But Indians have always loved their beans, so does this trend really apply to us?

Trump signs order to lift tariffs on beef, coffee, fruits amid price concernsTrump signed an executive order removing tariffs on commodities like beef and coffee to address consumer price concerns. The move follows growing economic dissatisfaction, with Democrats winning key elections.

Medical body cancels registration of doctors linked to Faridabad terror moduleFour doctors accused in the Faridabad-based terror module have been struck off the national and state medical registers, barring them from practising anywhere in India.

Bihar chooses Modi-Nitish again in stunning mandate, Mahagathbandhan routedThe NDA swept back to power in Bihar with a historic 202-seat mandate, decisively defeating the Mahagathbandhan as the BJP and JDU posted an 85 per cent strike rate.

WatchBollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan and choreographer Farah Khan entertained attendees at a recent Mumbai event, marking the unveiling of the Shahrukhz tower, with a dance performance to the classic song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya'. The preview highlights the characters' early connection and the challenges they face as they grow older.

sports.headline: Sanju Samson joins CSK, Ravindra Jadeja back in Rajasthan after a decade CSK's decision to overhaul its core has triggered one of the most significant trades in recent IPL history, with Sanju Samson moving to Chennai for Rs 18 crore and Ravindra Jadeja returning to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 14 crore.

Australia suffer injury blow as Josh Hazlewood ruled out of first Ashes Test Australia have suffered a major setback ahead of the opening Ashes Test in Perth, with senior seamer Josh Hazlewood ruled out due to a hamstring strain, and Michael Neser, who has played two Tests, drafted in as cover.

What to expect on IPL 2026 retention deadline day IPL 2026 retention deadline day buzz: With Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals set to swap Ravindra Jadeja and Sanju Samson, and Mohammed Shami joining Lucknow Super Giants alongside Arjun Tendulkar, the build-up has already delivered blockbuster trades ahead of the 5 PM IST deadline on November 15.

Ashes: Zak Crawley confident England will be ready despite limited preparations Opener Zak Crawley is confident England will be ready for next week's first Ashes Test against Australia in Perth, despite criticism over the team's limited preparation ahead of the five-match series.

Babar Azam on ending hundred drought: When Allah has written something, it happens Babar Azam was ecstatic after ending his century drought during the second ODI win against Sri Lanka. Babar ended an 807-day drought to help Pakistan clinch the series and he praised the almighty for the feat.

Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR completed: Report The Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja deal between CSK and RR has been completed, according to a latest report. The Royals will also get Sam Curran along with Jadeja as Samson heads in the other direction.

World champion Deepti Sharma felicitated at UP Police Headquarters in Lucknow Deepti Sharma, the Player of the Tournament at the Women's ODI World Cup and newly appointed DSP in the Uttar Pradesh Police under the sports quota, was felicitated on Friday at the State Police Headquarters in Gomtinagar Extension.

IND vs SA 1st Test Day 2 Live: Harmer removes Sundar, Gill in India vs South Africa 1st Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: A slow start to the proceedings by KL Rahul and Washington Sundar as both men have been watchful with their innings. The pitch is still up to its tricks, with the bowlers getting some purchase off the track still.

IPL 2026 retentions complete guide: Rules, live streaming details, team purse The deadline for all ten franchises of the Indian Premier League to reveal their list of retained and released players is 15th November 2024. As the teams finalise their squad for the mini auction scheduled in December, here's our complete guide to IPL 2026 retention rules.

Devon Conway confirms CSK exit ahead of IPL 2026 retentions, thanks fans New Zealand opener Devon Conway has confirmed his release from the Chennai Super Kings on Friday, November 14, a day ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions. Conway spent three years with CSK and thanked the fans.

Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR completed: Report The Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja deal between CSK and RR has been completed, according to a latest report. The Royals will also get Sam Curran along with Jadeja as Samson heads in the other direction.

World champion Deepti Sharma felicitated at UP Police Headquarters in Lucknow Deepti Sharma, the Player of the Tournament at the Women's ODI World Cup and newly appointed DSP in the Uttar Pradesh Police under the sports quota, was felicitated on Friday at the State Police Headquarters in Gomtinagar Extension.

The pitch is still up to its tricks, with the bowlers getting some purchase off the track still.

As the teams finalise their squad for the mini auction scheduled in December, here's our complete guide to IPL 2026 retention rules.

Devon Conway confirms CSK exit ahead of IPL 2026 retentions, thanks fans New Zealand opener Devon Conway has confirmed his release from the Chennai Super Kings on Friday, November 14, a day ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions. Conway spent three years with CSK and thanked the fans.

Babar Azam ends 807-day century drought, equals Saeed Anwar's ODI recordBabar Azam ended his 807-day century drought with an unbeaten 102 against Sri Lanka in the 2nd ODI in Rawalpindi. His innings helped Pakistan chase down 289 and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Wrestling body lifts suspension of Olympic medallist Aman for missing weightThe Wrestling Federation of India has lifted the suspensions of Aman Sehrawat and Neha Sangwan for weight violations. This decision allows them to enter the Pro Wrestling League auction, but warns of stricter action for any future lapses.

IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada's availability remains uncertain for 2nd TestKagiso Rabada remains a doubtful starter for the second Test against India after missing the series opener due to a rib injury. South Africa are awaiting further medical assessments to determine his availability.

Tough self-judge? Vaibhav Suryavanshi rates his 42-ball 144 out of 100Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi lit up Doha with a stunning 42-ball 144, but the 14-year-old wasn't fully satisfied. Even after one of the biggest knocks of his young career, he rated it with striking honesty and restraint.

No magic, just mastery: Jasprit Bumrah on dismantling South Africa in Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah turned a dry Eden Gardens pitch into his stage, ripping through South Africa with a superb five-for. After silencing fitness critics, he reminded everyone that his craft isn't magic but pure skill, patience and relentless accuracy.

South Africa coach plays down Jasprit Bumrah's 'bauna' remark for Temba BavumaSouth Africa batting coach Ashwell Prince has dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's on-field remark about Temba Bavuma during the opening day of the first Test at Eden Gardens. Prince clarified that the team will not discuss the incident, while no complaint will be made regarding the exchange captured on the stump mic.

Mohammed Shami set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants for IPL 2026: ReportIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Mohammed Shami is set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026). Shami was bought for Rs 10 Crore at IPL 2025 mega auction but failed to live up to his reputation.

Control your temptation: Jasprit Bumrah's guide to acing tricky Eden Gardens pitchIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: After claiming a sensational five-wicket haul, Jasprit Bumrah explained why it isn't easy for fast bowlers to find success on a dry pitch like the one at Eden Gardens on Day 1 of the series opener in Kolkata.

Prince clarified that the team will not discuss the incident, while no complaint will be made regarding the exchange captured on the stump mic.

Shami was bought for Rs 10 Crore at IPL 2025 mega auction but failed to live up to his reputation.

Hardik Pandya kept in touch, motivated me: Allah Ghazanfar hopes to be retained by MIAM Ghazanfar, Afghanistan's 19-year-old mystery spinner, reflects on a demanding year and looks ahead to potential retention by the Mumbai Indians for the 2026 IPL season.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: DC eye reset in overseas combination, pace unitAs the Delhi Capitals gear up for IPL 2026, they will be eager to address some glaring weaknesses in their squad ahead of the mini-auction. An overhaul of the overseas opening slot and a reset in the fast-bowling department will be among their top priorities. With the 15 November deadline approaching, here's a probable list of players DC are expected to retain.

Jasprit Bumrah's name also gets him wickets, not just his accuracy: Dale SteynLegendary South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn feels Jasprit Bumrah's name also plays a major role in him getting wickets. The India fast bowler dismantled South Africa with a five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the first Test at Eden Gardens

At 14, Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes 32-ball hundred in Rising Stars Asia CupAsia Cup Rising Stars 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi brought up his second T20 hundred, this time in 32 balls. The left-handed batter shone for India A in their opening match of the tournament against the UAE In Doha on Friday, November 14.

Asia Cup Rising Stars live streaming: When and where to watch India A vs UAE online in IndiaAsia Cup Rising Stars 2025 live streaming and TV telecast guide: India A, led by Jitesh Sharma, have won the toss and opted to bat in their opening match against the UAE at West End Park International Cricket Stadium in Doha.

Kolkata Test: Bumrah rediscovers mojo on dry pitch, razes South Africa on Day 1IND vs SA, Kolkata Test Day 1: Jasprit Bumrah roared back to top gear with a fiery five-wicket haul that dismantled South Africa for 159, setting up a commanding position for India on a dramatic opening day at Eden Gardens.

Bumrah emulates Dale Steyn with menacing spell against South Africa in KolkataJasprit Bumrah delivered a stunning five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens. Courtesy of his spell, South Africa were bundled out for 159 in their first innings.

Bangladesh hammer Ireland by an innings and 47 runs in SylhetBangladesh recorded a dominant win over Ireland inside four days in Sylhet, thanks to Hasan Murad's four wickets and centuries from Mahmudul Hasan Joy and captain Najmul Hossain Shanto. Despite resistance from Andy McBrine and Andy Balbirnie, Ireland fell short by an innings and 47 runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
